data.title: ICv2: 'Brickleberry' Animated Comedy Comes to Comics
meta_keywords: Harry Potter. Genres we cover include fantasy
data.meta_description: Daily coverage of the pop culture products industry, including toys (action figures, models and statues), anime (anime, manga, and Japanese imports), games (collectible card and roleplaying games or ccgs and rpgs), comics (comics and graphic novels), and movie and TV (licensed) merchandise. We feature business news, and in-depth analysis for retailers, publishers, manufacturers, distributors. Trade properties we cover include Star Wars, Star Trek, X-Men, Gundam Wing, Dragonball Z, Pokemon, Akira, Lone Wolf and Cub, Magic the Gathering, Dungeons and Dragons, Mage Knight, Superman, Spider-man, JLA, Batman, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, J.R.R. Tolkien, Sailor Moon, Sandman, Harry Potter. Genres we cover include fantasy, science fiction, horror.
data.text:
Dynamite Entertainment has partnered with Bento Box Entertainment to release a new series based on the Comedy Central animated series Brickleberry.

Created by Waco O’Guin and Roger Black, the series premiered in 2012 and followed the lives of federal park rangers, including Woody Johnson, who worked in a fictitious Brickleberry National Park. The series ran for three seasons. Dynamite is now working with the show’s creators to craft a series which picks up right where the show’s season finale left off.

“We truly believe this series will make all our Brickleberry fans very happy,” said co-creator Roger Black. “Also, we are thrilled at the possibility of reaching the tons of comic book fans who might not yet know of the show.”

Dynamite previously partnered with Bento Box to produce Bob’s Burgers comic books (see “New 'Bob's Burgers' Ongoing Series”).
